pr_title: [#2166] Improve 503 error messages in HTTP adapter

timeline.bodyText: this looks like it would be helpful in both ClientErrorException and ServerErrorException. Thus, IMHO we should add this to ServiceInvocationException.
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.author: calohmn

timeline.author: sophokles73
sophokles73

timeline.bodyText:
FMPOV you have now opened Pandora's Box of (localized) messages ;-)
I do not think that we should populate our constants classes with full fledged error messages ...
Instead, we should probably use resource bundles which have been designed for this purpose.
timeline.author: sophokles73
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -56,6 +56,24 @@
  */
 public abstract class AbstractSender extends AbstractHonoClient implements MessageSender {
 
+    /**
+     * Client facing error message for the case of a message sender not receiving a delivery update in time.
+     * May be used as {@link ServerErrorException#clientFacingMessage}.
+     */
+    public static final String ERROR_SEND_MESSAGE_TIMEOUT = "consumer failed to indicate in time whether it has processed the message";

replies.bodyText:
Using a resource bundle just for these error messages seems a bit overkill to me. We also don't use a resource bundle for the ClientErrorException messages already being included in HTTP responses.
I mainly introduced these constants to match the error message in the unit tests. As we rarely use such error message checks in unit tests, I could just remove them and then also remove the constants.
replies.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText: FMPOV it would actually be the right choice for the problem at hand. I also do not think that it is much effort to implement.
replies.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: So you mean introducing a resource bundle, used then also for the ClientErrorException messages?
replies.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText: You mean for the already existing messages? IMHO that should be the goal then, yes. We could maybe use a step-by-step approach here but in the end we should use the same mechanism. FMPOV this is even more desirable if we want to provide more elaborate messages than bad JSON ...
replies.author: sophokles73

+# ServiceInvocationException messages

+SERVER_ERROR_MESSAGE_NOT_PROCESSED=consumer didn't process the message
+SERVER_ERROR_NO_CONSUMER=no consumer available

timeline.bodyText: the consumer did not process the message in this case as well
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText:
yes, but I think the "not found/don't try again" semantics of the exception would then need to be put into the message as well. How about using
SERVER_ERROR_MESSAGE_UNDELIVERABLE=consumer declared message as undeliverable, it should not be redelivered
here?
replies.author: calohmn

timeline.bodyText:
wow, this looks terrible, doesn't it ;-)
Maybe we can add a static String ServiceInvocationException.getLocalizedMessage(String) method which accepts a key instead?
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText:
Well, I agree that it doesn't look pretty and I was actually a bit hesitant, using that. However, it's in a test and as an advantage, the resource handling and keys can be kept internal to the exception classes that way.
But ok, I've changed it to use ServiceInvocationException.getLocalizedMessage() now.
